description: Cysteine modifications have been widely detected among different protein in different species. Here, we examined protein glutathionylation in HeLa cells under both untreated and diamide-treated conditions. A strategy using resin-assisted enrichment of glutathionylated proteins or peptides after biotin-switch is commonly used for detection of glutathionylation and other reversible cysteine modifications, and was also applied in this study. Using these strategies we identified a large number of glutathionylated protein with modification sites under both untreated and diamide-treated conditions.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: S-glutathionylation, nanoLC-LTQ-Orbitrap XL MS/MS, biotin switch

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Yang J, Zhang H, Gong W, Liu Z, Wu H, Hu W, Chen X, Wang L, Wu S, Chen C, Perrett S. S-Glutathionylation of human inducible Hsp70 reveals a regulatory mechanism involving the C-terminal α-helical lid. J Biol Chem. 2020

title: Protein S-glutathionylation in HeLa cells identified by nanoLC-LTQ-Orbitrap XL MS/MS
